org.fujion.core

Class WebUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fujion.core.WebUtil

  • public class WebUtil
extends Object
    Utility methods for accessing and manipulating web resources and settings.

    • Method Detail

      • initDebug

        public static void initDebug(javax.servlet.ServletContext servletContext)
        Initialize the debug state. This is determined by the fujion.debug property value taken from the system properties or, absent that, from the the context parameter settings in the web.xml file. This method is called during server startup and cannot be called more than one.
        Parameters:
        servletContext - The servlet context.

      • isDebugEnabled

        public static boolean isDebugEnabled()
        Returns the debug state of the servlet. When enabled (see initDebug(javax.servlet.ServletContext)), the debug state can affect various application behaviors such as disabling javascript minification.
        Returns:
        The debug state.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown if debug status has not been initialized.

      • queryStringToMap

        public static Map<String,String> queryStringToMap(String queryString)
        Converts the queryString to a map.
        Parameters:
        queryString - The query string (leading "?" is optional)
        Returns:
        A map containing the parameters from the query string. This may return null if the queryString is empty. Multiple values for a parameter are separated by commas.

      • queryStringToMap

        public static Map<String,String> queryStringToMap(String queryString,
                                                  String valueDelimiter)
        Converts the queryString to a map.
        Parameters:
        queryString - The query string (leading "?" is optional)
        valueDelimiter - String to use to delimit multiple values for a parameter. May be null.
        Returns:
        A map containing the arguments from the query string. This may return null if the queryString is empty.

      • addQueryString

        public static String addQueryString(String url,
                                    String queryString)
        Adds the specified query string to the url.
        Parameters:
        url - url to receive the query string.
        queryString - Query string to add.
        Returns:
        The updated url.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if url is null

      • getQueryParams

        public static String getQueryParams()
        Returns the query parameter string from the request url.
        Returns:
        The query parameter string or empty string if none.

      • getRequestUrl

        public static String getRequestUrl()
        Returns the original request url from the execution context.
        Returns:
        The request url of the browser document.

      • getBaseUrl

        public static String getBaseUrl()
        Returns the base url from the execution context.
        Returns:
        The base url.

      • getCookie

        public static javax.servlet.http.Cookie getCookie(String cookieName)
        Returns the named cookie from the current request.
        Parameters:
        cookieName - Name of cookie.
        Returns:
        A cookie, or null if not found.
        See Also:
        getCookie(String, HttpServletRequest)

      • getCookie

        public static javax.servlet.http.Cookie getCookie(String cookieName,
                                                  javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest httpRequest)
        Returns the named cookie from the specified request. When values are retrieved, they should be decoded.
        Parameters:
        cookieName - Name of cookie
        httpRequest - Request containing cookie.
        Returns:
        A cookie, or null if not found.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if arguments are null
        See Also:
        decodeCookieValue(String)

      • getCookieValue

        public static String getCookieValue(String cookieName,
                                    javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest httpRequest)
        Returns the value from the named cookie from the specified request. The value is decoded with for security and consistency (Version 0+ of Cookies and web containers)
        Parameters:
        cookieName - Name of cookie
        httpRequest - Request containing cookie.
        Returns:
        A cookie value, or null if not found.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if arguments are null
        See Also:
        getCookie(String, HttpServletRequest), decodeCookieValue(String)

      • encodeCookieValue

        public static String encodeCookieValue(String cookieValuePlainText)

        Encodes a plain text cookie value.

        Note: The direction to use a two-phase encode/decode process (i.e. instead of the Base64 class URL_SAFE option) was intentional
        Parameters:
        cookieValuePlainText - The plain text to encode
        Returns:
        encoded cookie value
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the argument is null
        See Also:
        URLEncoder.encode(String, String), Base64.encodeBase64String(byte[])

      • decodeCookieValue

        public static String decodeCookieValue(String encodedCookieValue)

        Decodes an encoded cookie value

        Note: The direction to use a two-phase encode/decode process (i.e. instead of the Base64 class URL_SAFE option) was intentional
        Parameters:
        encodedCookieValue - The encoded cookie value
        Returns:
        decoded cookie value
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the argument is null
        See Also:
        URLDecoder.decode(String, String), BaseNCodec.decode(String)

      • getCookieValue

        public static String getCookieValue(String cookieName)
        Returns the value from the named cookie from the specified request. The value is decoded.
        Parameters:
        cookieName - Name of cookie
        Returns:
        A cookie value, or null if not found.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if argument is null or if underlying HttpServletRequest is null
        See Also:
        getCookieValue(String, HttpServletRequest)

      • setCookie

        public static javax.servlet.http.Cookie setCookie(String cookieName,
                                                  String value,
                                                  javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse httpResponse,
                                                  javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest httpRequest)
        Sets a cookie into the response. Cookies are URLEncoded for consistency (Version 0+ of Cookies)
        Parameters:
        cookieName - Name of cookie.
        value - Value of cookie. If null, the cookie is removed from the client if it exists.
        httpResponse - Response object.
        httpRequest - Request object.
        Returns:
        Newly created cookie.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if cookieName, httpResponse, or httpRequest arguments are null

      • getResource

        public static org.springframework.core.io.Resource getResource(String src)
        Returns the resource corresponding to the source URL.
        Parameters:
        src - The URL of the source.
        Returns:
        The corresponding resource.
